snippet: When the United States last week declared the Haqqani network in Afghanistan to be a terrorist organization, the Taliban's reaction was angry, swift and deadly. Noting the close ties between the Haqqanis and Pakistan's main spy agency, some analysts...
abstract: When the United States last week declared the Haqqani network in Afghanistan to be a terrorist organization, the Taliban's reaction was angry, swift and deadly. Noting the close ties between the Haqqanis and Pakistan's main spy agency, some analysts saw a possibility that Pakistan itself might some day be declared a state sponsor of terrorism.

headline.main: Taliban Rages Over U.S. Decision on Terrorist Group

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: No Easy Day: The Firsthand Account of the Mission That Killed Osama bin Laden (Book)
